title: Australians set to spend record $1.6 billion on Boxing Day | ABC NEWS
description: Economists are predicting Boxing Day sales to be the biggest on record. Fleur Brown from the Australian Retailers Association is expecting $3.8 billion to be spent across the country on Boxing Day week. title: Life in one of the world's most polluted cities | ABC NEWS
description: Indiaâ€™s capital is home to more than 30 million people and routinely ranks among the world's most polluted cities.  Each winter, farmers burn crop residue in nearby states and cooler temperatures trap the smoke that mixes with vehicle and industrial emissions. From studying, going to work to enjoying roadside chai, Delhi's poor air quality has impacted nearly all aspects of life.  By Angelica Silva, ABC Asia Pacific Newsroom. title: Christmas heatwave sweeps WA, risk of severe storms for east coast | ABC NEWS
description: Heatwave and fire danger warnings have been issued for parts of Western Australia as soaring temperatures in Perth could exceed the city's warmest Christmas morning on record. Meanwhile, the risk of severe thunderstorms on Christmas Day looms over northern NSW and south-east Queensland. Tropical Cyclone Grant is building offshore at the continent's north-east and tracking towards the Cocos Islands, expected to intensify to a category two system overnight. title: Charities experience a spike in volunteers at Christmas, but they need year-round support | ABC NEWS
description: Charities are urging eager Christmas volunteers to spread their goodwill throughout the year, as they grapple with a shrinking volunteer pool and increasing demand.  The community sector has long experienced a boom in people wanting to give back around the festive season. title: Two men found guilty of planning antisemitic attack in Manchester | ABC NEWS
description: Amar Hussein and Walid Saadaoui have been found guilty of plotting an Islamic State inspired attack targeting the Jewish community in the United Kingdom. British detectives say it could have been the deadliest terrorist attack in the country's history. One of the men's planned targets was close to the Manchester synagogue where two men were killed in an antisemitic terror attack in October 2025. title: Black market tobacco trader in Qld racks up $7m in unpaid fines | ABC NEWS
description: Since the Queensland government's crackdown on the illicit tobacco trade, operators are chalking up unpaid fines so large that one player alone owes more than $7 million. The next five largest debtors owe between $1 million and $2 million each. It's the latest hurdle in authorities' challenging bid to stifle the flourishing nicotine black market in Australia. title: Latest Epstein files include 'fake' documents, US Justice Department says | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 The US Department of Justice (DOJ) has published almost 30,000 new documents after failing to meet a deadline for the release of all the files last week. But in a series of tweets, the DOJ cast doubt on some of the documents, including what it called a "fake" note from Jeffrey Epstein that mentioned US President Donald Trump. 01:22 The latest tranche also included an email revealing 'A' at 'Balmoral' sought 'inappropriate friends' from Ghislaine Maxwell, raising more questions around the conduct of former-Prince Andrew. title: NSW premier says tougher gun, protest laws increase safety | ABC NEWS
description: Premier Chris Minns says the NSW government is "not done with reform" as sweeping new laws come into effect after being approved by NSW Parliament. The bill passed after a long debate 18 votes to eight and included a key amendment from the Greens on tightening firearms laws for people with suspected terrorist links. title: Questions raised over police readiness following Bondi attack | ABC NEWS
description: In the immediate days after the Bondi terrorist attack, NSW Premier Chris Minns and the NSW Police Force said police "policies" and "resources" in response to major incidents would be reviewed. It's raised questions around readiness for police to respond to active shooter threats, particularly in public places. title: WA Police charge man accused of pledging support to Bondi shooters | ABC NEWS
description: A Perth man has appeared in court charged with posting antisemitic comments on social media, allegedly pledging his support for the Bondi Beach shooters just hours after the deadly terror attack. Martin Thomas Glynn was also charged with having thousands of rounds of unsecured ammunition at his home in Perth's south. Police told the court they also found a bomb-making shopping list and antisemitic material at his property. The 39-year-old represented himself in court where he was refused bail. title: Tough new gun laws, protest crackdowns pass NSW parliament | ABC NEWS
description: After a marathon debate, the NSW government's controversial law reforms sparked by the Bondi massacre have passed parliament.  Under the legislation individual gun owners will be limited to four firearms, while primary producers will be allowed 10 firearms.   The other part of the legislation passed overnight will restrict mass protests in the wake of a terrorism incident. title: Australians prepare for holiday season as Bondi casts long shadow | ABC NEWS
description: As Australians prepare for the holiday season, leaders have delivered a message of hope in a time of darkness. Crowds are returning to Sydney's Bondi Beach in the wake of the deadly terror attack that claimed 15 lives, and locals are taking time to reflect amid the festivities.
